page.title: 03Caldwell MA
page.content: Caldwell has{no green}but it has several fields in the centre.It used to have a post office but it closed down. The school closed down in 1932 and has been converted into a house. There was a smithy and it has been converted into a house which is called Forge House. It has one{pub}which is called The Brownlow Arms. The main{materials}used for building the houses are stone and tile. There are two council houses which are built of brick, and they are the only ones made of brick and they are on the road to Eppleby. The oldest thing in Caldwell is the{dovecote.}The{church} was built in 1844 and paid for by Charlotte Catherine Ann Countess of Bridgewater. The{population}of Caldwell in 1881 was 175 and in 1981 it was 106. Most of the houses are over 100 years old.
